intro: Eschscholzia californica subsp. californica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers and delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in open grasslands and coastal areas. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is known for its short lifespan, typically blooming in spring and going to seed by summer. The California poppy is also recognized for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its analgesic and sedative effects.
